meanings.definition: To seek favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: He would always bootlick the boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She tried to bootlick her way into getting special treatment.
meanings.sent3: The cat would bootlick the owner for extra treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician would bootlick the voters to gain their support.
meanings.sent5: The student decided to bootlick the teacher for a better grade.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks favor by flattery or servile behavior.
meanings.sent1: The bootlick always praised the supervisor to get ahead.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office bootlick for always seeking favors.
meanings.sent3: The little bootlick would follow the principal around all day.
meanings.sent4: The bootlick in the group was always looking for special treatment.
meanings.sent5: The bootlick's constant flattery annoyed everyone around them.
